content:
Diagnosis:
Low grade serous ovarian carcinoma, stage IIIA
BRAF V600E mutation positive
Small volume peritoneal disease

Previous treatment:
Primary debulking surgery 15 Jan 2024
Started MEK inhibitor (Trametinib) 12 Mar 2024

Current medications:
Trametinib 2mg daily

Current situation:
Review prior to cycle 3 Trametinib

CT scan 10 May 2024 shows partial response with reduction in peritoneal disease

CA125 trending down from 450 to 180

Treatment tolerance:
Grade 1 rash managed with topical emollients
Mild fatigue improving

Examination:
Performance status 1
Soft abdomen, no ascites
No peripheral edema

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is tolerating treatment well with improving symptoms. Her main side effect has been a mild rash which is adequately controlled with regular moisturizer. Fatigue has improved since starting treatment. Blood tests show stable renal and liver function. Given the good radiological response and tolerability, we will continue with the current dose of Trametinib. Follow up arranged in 4 weeks with repeat CA125.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows partial response with reduction in peritoneal disease

status_updates.value: Low grade serous ovarian cancer showing partial response to MEK inhibitor therapy with good tolerability
Partial response on CT with reduction in peritoneal disease and falling CA125
Grade 1 rash managed with topical emollients, mild improving fatigue
Continuing Trametinib 2mg daily at current dose
Follow up arranged in 4 weeks with repeat CA125
